title: Japan delays H2A launch in the wake of H3 failure
summary: Japan has delayed the launch of a H-2A rocket planned for May to no earlier than August in the wake of the failed inaugural flight of H3 rocket.

title: Here come the Moon landing missions (probably)
summary: Three for NASA, and one each for India, Russia, and Japan.

title: Japanese H-IIA set for second launch attempt of X-ray telescope and lunar lander
summary: The Mitsubishi Heavy Industries H-IIA launch vehicle, as its career is being wound down in favor of the H3, is preparing to fly the Smart Lander for Investigating Moon (SLIM) robotic lunar lander and the X-Ray Imaging and Spectroscopy Mission (XRISM) X-ray telescope on its 47th flight. After this flight, the second of 2023 for the H-IIA, the H-IIA will have three flights left before retirement.
